original: Mahāparinirvāṇasūtra
analyzed: mahāparinirvāṇasūtra
translated: Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra

original: vitarkā viditā utpadyate viditās tiṣṭati viditā adhyastagacchati /
analyzed: vitarkāḥ vid utpadyate vid tiṣṭati vid adhyastagacchati
translated: Thoughts are known when they arise, known when they remain, known when they depart.

original: idam api yūyam ānanda tathāgatasyāścaryādbhutadharma dhārayata / evam āścaryādbhutadharmasamanvāgata ānanda tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: idam api yūyam ānanda tathāgatasya āścarya adbhuta dharma dhārayata evam āścarya adbhuta dharma samanvāgataḥ ānanda tathāgataḥ
translated: You should remember this, Ānanda, as a marvelous and wonderful quality of the Tathāgata. In this way, Ānanda, the Tathāgata is endowed with marvelous and wonderful qualities.

original: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmatrayāmāsa / āgamayānanda yena gandhamādana caitya tenopasakramiṣyāvaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmatrayāmāsa āgamaya ānanda yena gandhamādana caitya tena upasakramiṣyāvaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One invited the Venerable Ānanda, saying, Let us go, Ānanda, to the Gandhamādana shrine.

original: eva bhadata āyuṣmān ānando bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt /
analyzed: eva bhadata āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣīt
translated: Very well, Bhadanta, the Venerable Ānanda assented to the Blessed One.

original: atha bhagavān utthāyāsanād yena gandhamādana caitya tenopasakramati / āyuṣmān ānando niṣīdanam asenāropya bhagavata pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ
analyzed: atha bhagavān utthāya āsanāt yena gandhamādana caitya tena upasakramati āyuṣmān ānandaḥ niṣīdanam bhagavata pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Then the Blessed One rose from his seat and went to the Gandhamādana shrine, while the Venerable Ānanda put away the sitting mat and followed behind the Blessed One.

original: samanubaddhaḥ myānulomatayā /
analyzed: samanubaddhaḥ
translated: He followed closely behind the Blessed One.

original: atha bhagavā gandhamādana caityam abhyavagāhya yenānyatama vṛkṣamūla tenopasakramati / upasakramya āyuṣmatam ānandam āmatrayāmāsa
analyzed: atha bhagavān gandhamādana caityam abhyavagāhya yena anyatama vṛkṣa mūla tena upasakramati upasakramyaḥ āyuṣmatam ānandam āmatrayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the Gandhamādana shrine, went to the foot of a certain tree, and invited the Venerable Ānanda, saying,

original: prajñapayānandāsmi vṛkṣamūle tathāgatasya niṣīdana pṛṣṭhī me āglāyati tā tāvad āyāmayiṣye /
analyzed: prajñapaya ānanda asmi vṛkṣa mūle tathāgatasya niṣīdana pṛṣṭhī me āglāyati tā tāvat āyāmayiṣye
translated: I will arrange a seat for the Tathāgata at the foot of a tree. My back aches. I will stretch it out for a while.

original: eva bhadatāyuṣmān ānando bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya tasmi vṛkṣamūle bhagavato niṣīdana prajñapayāmāsa /
analyzed: eva bhadata āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya tasmin vṛkṣa mūle bhagavataḥ niṣīdana prajñapayāmāsa
translated: Having heard this from the Blessed One, the Venerable Ānanda arranged a seat for the Blessed One at the foot of a tree.

original: nyaṣīdad bhagavā prajñapta evāsane /āyuṣmān apy ānando bhagavata ekāte nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: nyaṣīdat bhagavā prajñapte eva āsane āyuṣmān api ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ ekāte nyaṣīdat
translated: The Blessed One sat down on the seat arranged, and the Venerable Ānanda also sat down to one side.

original: niṣadya bhagavā āyuṣmatam ānandam āmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: niṣadya bhagavān āyuṣmatam ānandam āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Having sat down, the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Ānanda:

original: yāvata ānanda bhikṣavo gandhamādana caityam upaniḥśṛtya viharati tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyā sanipātaya /🔽eva bhadatāyuṣmān ānanda bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya yāvato bhikṣavo gandhamādana
analyzed: yāvataḥ ānanda bhikṣavaḥ gandhamādana caityam upaniḥśṛtya viharati tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyā sanipātaya  eva bhadata āyuṣmān ānanda bhagavataḥ pratiśrutya yāvataḥ bhikṣavaḥ gandhamādana
translated: Ānanda, gather together all the monks who are staying in dependence on the Gandhamādana shrine in the assembly hall.

original: caityam upaniḥṣṛtya viharati tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyā sanipātayāmāsa / sanipātya
analyzed: caityam upaniḥṣṭhatya viharati tān sarvān upasthānaśālāyā sanipātayāmāsa sanipātya
translated: Having heard this from the Blessed One, the Venerable Ānanda gathered together all the monks who were staying in dependence on the Gandhamādana shrine in the assembly hall. Having gathered them together,

original: śirasā bhagavataḥ pādau vattvaikānte asthāt /
analyzed: śirasā bhagavataḥ pādau vattvā ekānte asthāt
translated: he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and stood to one side.

original: ekāntasthita āyuṣmān ānando bhagavatam idam avocat /
analyzed: ekānta sthitaḥ āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavatam idam avocat
translated: Standing to one side, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: yāvato bhadanta bhikṣavo gandhamādanacaityam upaniḥśṛtya viharati sarve te upasthānaśālāyā sanipatitāḥ / yasyedānī bhagavān kāla 🔽manyate /
analyzed: yāvataḥ bhadanta bhikṣavaḥ gandhamādana caityam upaniḥśṛtya viharati sarve te upasthānaśālāyā sa nipatitāḥ yasya idānī bhagavān kāla  manyate
translated: As many monks as there are, reverend Sir, who are staying in dependence on the Gandhamadana shrine, all of them have assembled in the assembly hall. Now is the time for whatever the Fortunate One is thinking, reverend Sir.

original: atha bhagavān utthāyāsanād yenopasthānaśālā tenopasakrānta upasakramya prajñapta evāsane nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: atha bhagavān utthāya āsanāt yena upasthānaśālā tena upasakrāntaḥ upasakramya prajñapte eva āsane nyaṣīdat
translated: Then the Fortunate One, having risen from his seat, approached the assembly hall, and after approaching and entering the assembly hall, he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: niṣaṇṇo bhagavā bhikṣūn āmatrayāmāsa /
analyzed: niṣaṇṇaḥ bhagavān bhikṣūn āmatrayāmāsa
translated: While sitting down the Fortunate One addressed the monks, saying:🔽“Therefore, monks, those things that I have directly known and declared,

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavo ye mayā dharmāḥ svayam abhijñāya sākṣīkṛtvopasapadya praveditās
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ye mayā dharmāḥ svayam abhijñāya sākṣīkṛtvā upasapadya praveditāḥ
translated: having understood them through my own mind,

original: tadyathā catvāri smṛtyupasthānāni catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catvāro ṛddhipādāḥ pañcendriyāṇi
analyzed: tat yathā catvāri smṛti upasthānāni catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catvāraḥ ṛddhipādāḥ pañca indriyāṇi
translated: namely, the four ways of attending to mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of spiritual success, the five spiritual faculties,

original: pañca balāni sapta bodhyṅgāny āryāṣṭāṅgo mārgaḥ tatra vaḥ sarvaiḥ sahitaiḥ samagraiḥ
analyzed: pañca balāni sapta bodhyṅgāni ārya aṣṭa aṅgaḥ mārgaḥ tatra vaḥ sarvaiḥ sahitaiḥ samagraiḥ
translated: the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the noble eightfold path, in that (regard) all of you, united,

original: samodamānair avivadadbhir ekāgrair ekoddeśair ekakṣīrodakabhūtaiḥ dīpayamānaiḥ
analyzed: samodamānaiḥ a vivadadbhiḥ ekāgraiḥ eka uddeśaiḥ eka kṣīra udaka bhūtaiḥ dīpayamānaiḥ
translated: harmonious, with a commonality of purpose, as if (constituting) one person, should live, delighting in concord,

original: sukhasparśa vihartavyam /
analyzed: sukha sparśa vihartavyam
translated: experiencing pleasant dwellings.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavo ye mayā dharmā ākhyātās tadyathā sūtra geya vyākaraṇa gāthodānā
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ye mayā dharmāḥ ākhyātāḥ tat yathā
translated: Therefore, monks, those dharmas that have been taught by me, namely the sutras, geyas, vyakarana, gathas, udanas,

original: nidānāvadānā itivṛttakajātakavaipulyādbhutadharmopadeśās te dharmā bhavadbhiḥ sādhu
analyzed: nidāna avadānāḥ iti vṛttaka jātaka vaipulya adbhuta dharma upadeśāḥ te dharmāḥ bhavadbhiḥ sādhu
translated: nidanas, avadanas, itivrittakas, jatakas, vaipulyas, adbhutadharmas, those dharmas should be well

original: ca suṣṭhu codgrahītavyā udgṛhya dhārayitavyā dhārayitvā tulayitavyāḥ tulayitvā niśāmayitavyā
analyzed: ca suṣṭhu ca udgrahītavyāḥ udgṛhya dhārayitavyāḥ dhārayitvā tulayitavyāḥ tulayitvā niśāmayitavyā
translated: and thoroughly learned by you. Having learned them, they should be retained. Having retained them, they should be weighed. Having weighed them, they should be contemplated.

original: niśāmya tathā tathā pratipattavyam /🔽tat kasmād dhetoḥ / acireṇa tathāgatasya parinirvāṇa bhaviṣyati / trayāṇā māsānām
analyzed: niśāmya tathā tathā pratipattavyam  tat kasmāt hetoḥ acireṇa tathāgatasya parinirvāṇa bhaviṣyati trayāṇām māsānām
translated: Having contemplated them, one should practice accordingly.🔽Why is that? Because before long, the Tathagata's parinirvana will occur.

original: atyayena tathāgatasya parinirvāṇa bhaviṣyati kuśinagaryupavartane mallānā sālavane
analyzed: atyayena tathāgatasya parinirvāṇa bhaviṣyati kuśinagarī upavartane sāla vane
translated: After three months have passed, the Tathagata's parinirvana will occur in the Mallas' town of Kusinagara, between the twin sal trees.

original: antare yamakasālayoḥ /
analyzed: antare yamaka sālayoḥ
translated: In the Mallas' town of Kusinagara, between the twin sal trees.

original: atha te bhikṣavo bhagavatontikād ida evarūpa vākya śrutvā ekatyā bhikṣavaḥ cchinnaprapāta pṛthivyā nipetuś cetobh samarpitāḥ atikṣipra
analyzed: atha te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ untikāt idam evarūpa vākya śrutvā ekatyāḥ bhikṣavaḥ chinna prapāta pṛthivyāḥ nipetuḥ cetobh samarpitāḥ ati kṣipra
translated: Then those monks, having heard these words from the Blessed One, some monks, their minds bewildered, fell down on the ground like cut reeds, thinking How quickly the Blessed One will attain parinirvana!🔽How quickly the Eye of the World will disappear!
